page.title: 05CHANGE ,THE CLOUD
page.content: Most of the land in our D block is agricultural.Farming has changed a lot in this century.In the past it was all done by horse because they didn't have modern machinery. The horses pulled ploughs and carts for carrying hay.A lot of men were needed to work on the farm. Often houses were smaller and families quite large.There was no central heating and homes were heated by coal.Most people either worked on farms or down a coal mine. A lot of people today work out of the area in local towns or the Potteries.The average size of a family today is 4 or 5. Most families today own at least one car, however in the past people had to walk or occasionally they had bicycles or horse drawn carts.
